clinicalDescription: Overview: Renal involvement in systemic lupus erythematous is common and is present as abnormal urinalysis with or without elevated serum creatinine. Degree of disease depends on site of immune complex mediate damage. Presentation: Commonly detected by screening for kidney disease among patients with SLE. Plan: Kidney biopsy should be performed in most patients, as it guide treatment choices - with six subclassed defined. Management includes combination of non immunological and immunological treatments. Prognosis: is tied to severity of SLE and rate of progression of kidney dysfunction
